intro: Heliosperma pusillum subsp. monachorum, commonly known as the dwarf heliosperma, is a small, flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, characterized by its succulent leaves and flowers. The subspecies monachorum is distinguished by its compact growth habit and pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by succulent enthusiasts.
